# Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKOpen day 2024

## Find your course

### Join for Jan 2025 Entry

We have lots of options to help you discover the right path for your future. Apply today for postgraduate study and join the UK’s Modern University of the year (Daily Mail University Guide 2025)

### Open Days 2024

Open Day is your opportunity to find out more about the courses, the facilities and the campus at Glasgow Caledonian University.

* * *

## Our research themes

[See all](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research)

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0017/255140/varieties/medium.jpg)

The University creates, gathers, stores and processes data on a variety of data subjects. The University takes its responsibility seriously and ensures that all processing is carried out in line with current data protection legislation.

markdown:
# Data Protection | Glasgow Caledonian University

The Data Protection Act 2018 is the UK’s implementation of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). This, along with the Data Protection Act 2018, introduces greater protection for personal data and brings data protection and data law into the digital age.

The University creates, gathers, stores and processes data on a variety of data subjects. The University takes its responsibility seriously and ensures that all processing is carried out in line with current data protection legislation.

Please access our Intranet site [Information Matters](https://www.connected.gcu.ac.uk/sites/InformationMatters)  for resources and further information (Internal use only).

The University's Data Protection ICO notification registration number is Z5761620

[Download the University's Data protection and privacy policy](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0019/151156/GCU_Data_Protection_and_Privacy_Policy_V1.3.pdf "Data Protection Policy")

**If you have any comments or questions regarding data protection at Glasgow Caledonian University, please contact Information Compliance on +44 141 331 8392 or email** [dataprotection@gcu.ac.uk.](mailto:dataprotection@gcu.ac.uk)

## Other useful guidelines and policies

Accessing Personal Information

Any individual the University holds personal data about can make a request for information.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/universitygovernance/data-protection/personalinformation)

Student Privacy Notice

Details of how we carefully handle your personal data in line with data protection law.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/policiesandprocedures/studentprivacynotice)

Privacy Notice for enquirers and applicants

Find out more about how your information is processed when you enquire or apply.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/policiesandprocedures/privacynoticeforenquirersandapplicants)

Visitor Privacy Notice

Find information about the GCU visitor and public privacy notice.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/universitygovernance/data-protection/visitorprivacynotice)

Special categories

Find out about The University's policy on processing special categories.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/universitygovernance/data-protection/specialcategories)

Student guide to processing personal data

Guidance to assist students who may process personal data.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/universitygovernance/data-protection/studentguidetoprocessingpersonaldata)

Contacting Research Participants

Process for contacting staff or students to participate in research.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/universitygovernance/data-protection/contactingresearchparticipants)

HESA

HESA Student and Staff collection notices are now live on the HESA website.

[Learn more](https://www.hesa.ac.uk/about/regulation/data-protection/notices)

Europe | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKEmbrace student life at Glasgow Caledonian University - be inspired by Dorota's story!
Glasgow Caledonian University has become one of the largest universities in Scotland with more than 22,000 students. Our international students come from over 130 different countries throughout the world and bring with them a diversity and enthusiasm which undoubtedly enriches the Caledonian experience for everyone.
Come meet us 
Our team at GCU takes part in various events throughout the year to advice and support you throughout the application process.
Talk to the team 
You can get in touch using our contact form or contact a member of the International Recruitment team if you would like to arrange a meeting in your country.
For Europe, please contact Lorna Campbell, Recruitment and Marketing Manager.
If you are currently living in the UK, we would love to show you around. Come see our campuses in Glasgow and London, with Open Days and Tours.

# Europe | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKEmbrace student life at Glasgow Caledonian University - be inspired by Dorota's story!

Glasgow Caledonian University has become one of the largest universities in Scotland with more than 22,000 students. Our international students come from over 130 different countries throughout the world and bring with them a diversity and enthusiasm which undoubtedly enriches the Caledonian experience for everyone.

Come meet us

Our team at GCU takes part in various events throughout the year to advice and support you throughout the application process.

Talk to the team

You can get in touch using [our contact form](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/enquire)  or contact a member of the International Recruitment team if you would like to arrange a meeting in your country.

For Europe, please contact [Lorna Campbell](mailto:lorna.campbell@gcu.ac.uk), Recruitment and Marketing Manager.

If you are currently living in the UK, we would love to show you around. Come see our campuses in Glasgow and London, with [Open Days and Tours.](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/opendaysandtours)

## More about your country

*   **[Bulgaria](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/bulgaria "Bulgaria why study at GCU")**
*   **[Cyprus](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/cyprus "Cyprus Why Study at GCU")**
*   **[Finland](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/finland "Finland why study at GCU")** 
*   **[France](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/france "France why study at GCU")**
*   **[Germany](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/germany "Germany why study at GCU")**
*   **[Greece](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/greece "Greece why study at GCU")**
*   **[Ireland](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/ireland "Ireland why study at GCU")**
*   **[Italy](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/italy "Italy why study at GCU")**
*   **[Poland](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/poland "Poland why study at GCU")**
*   **[Portugal](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/portugal "Portugal why study at GCU")**
*   **[Russia](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/russia "Russia why study at GCU")**
*   **[Spain](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/spain "Spain why study at GCU")**
*   **[Sweden](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/sweden "Sweden why study at GCU")**
*   **[Turkey](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/europe/turkey)**

### Meet Dorota

Hear how Polish student Dorota has embraced student life whilst studying at Glasgow Caledonian.

* * *

## Explore

Why study here?

Discover some of the reasons that GCU is the top choice for students from more than 130 countries.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/whystudyhere)

Open Days

Visit us to explore our campus, courses, and facilities, and to experience life at GCU firsthand during our university open days. Connect with peers, take a campus and accommodation tour, and gain insights from our staff and students about studying with us.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/opendays)

Scholarships and funding

Discover a range of financial help available to students, including funded scholarships, bursaries, tuition fee reductions and loyalty rewards.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/scholarships)

VISA Information

The Visa Immigration Support and Advice (VISA) Team at GCU are trained to give you advice and assistance on the application process and can check any supporting documents for you before your submission.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/summerschool/visainformation)

text:
Rest of the world | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKSCEBE International Experience
Why choose GCU?

Affordable tuition fees from £15,200 with scholarships and discounts available
Flexible eight-instalment payment plans for international students
Main campus is located in Glasgow, the fourth Best City in the World (Timeout 2022)
Contact us Come meet us Entry requirements 
The University accepts a variety of qualifications for entry to our courses. Simply send us copies of your grades and we can assess the equivalence we would consider these and subsequently advise on the best route for you to join us on your programme of choice. Contact international@gcu.ac.uk with details of your qualifications.
Below are some of the international qualifications we regularly accept. Hopefully, these are a guide to the scores we would be looking for in your education system. All entry requirements listed here should be used as a guide and represent the minimum required to be considered for entry. Please refer to the relevant course pages for essential subject requirements and grade ranges. Advanced entry is only possible where the qualification aligns with the course.
Undergraduate
A-Level: BCC
International Baccalaureate: 25 points
Cambridge Overseas Higher School Certificate (COHSC) or East African Advanced Certificate of Education (EAACE)
The West African Examination Council (WAEC) - minimum of 5 Bs
USA a minimum 2.7 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale, or equivalent and minimum grades in relevant subjects, where required. 
Where AP has been taken, we generally ask for grade 3 in two AP subjects. Where we require a specific subject at AP grade 3 and AP has not been taken, we will consider honours classes, or equivalent taken in that required subject. We require a copy of your high school transcripts including college or honours level grades. Please send your documents to admissions after you have applied via UCAS.
For applicants who have taken standardised tests, we will consider new SAT total score of 1000 or ACT score of 24 - (where a specific subject is required as part of entry criteria then a subject specific AP or honours high school grades will be considered as specified above).
Postgraduate
Postgraduate applicants will typically require a 2:2 honours bachelor's degree (UK system) or equivalent or a Bachelor's degree with 2.7 GPA (USA system) in a related subject area.
English language requirements

# Rest of the world | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKSCEBE International Experience

### Why choose GCU?

  
*   Affordable tuition fees from £15,200 with [scholarships and discounts](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/scholarships) available
*   Flexible eight-instalment [payment plans](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/tuitionfees/howtopay#schedules) for international students
*   Main campus is located in [Glasgow](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/whystudyhere/whystudyinglasgow), the fourth Best City in the World (Timeout 2022)

Contact us Come meet us Entry requirements

The University accepts a variety of qualifications for entry to our courses. Simply send us copies of your grades and we can assess the equivalence we would consider these and subsequently advise on the best route for you to join us on your programme of choice. Contact [international@gcu.ac.uk](mailto:international@gcu.ac.uk) with details of your qualifications.

Below are some of the international qualifications we regularly accept. Hopefully, these are a guide to the scores we would be looking for in your education system. All entry requirements listed here should be used as a guide and represent the minimum required to be considered for entry. Please refer to the relevant course pages for essential subject requirements and grade ranges. Advanced entry is only possible where the qualification aligns with the course.

#### Undergraduate

*   A-Level: BCC
*   International Baccalaureate: 25 points
*   Cambridge Overseas Higher School Certificate (COHSC) or East African Advanced Certificate of Education (EAACE)
*   The West African Examination Council (WAEC) - minimum of 5 Bs
*   USA a minimum 2.7 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale, or equivalent and minimum grades in relevant subjects, where required. 
    *   Where AP has been taken, we generally ask for grade 3 in two AP subjects. Where we require a specific subject at AP grade 3 and AP has not been taken, we will consider honours classes, or equivalent taken in that required subject. We require a copy of your high school transcripts including college or honours level grades. Please send your documents to admissions after you have applied via UCAS.
    *   For applicants who have taken standardised tests, we will consider new SAT total score of 1000 or ACT score of 24 - (where a specific subject is required as part of entry criteria then a subject specific AP or honours high school grades will be considered as specified above).

#### Postgraduate

Postgraduate applicants will typically require a 2:2 honours bachelor's degree (UK system) or equivalent or a Bachelor's degree with 2.7 GPA (USA system) in a related subject area.

English language requirements

### What to expect

Hear from some of our international students about their experience moving to Glasgow to study with us.

* * *

## Explore

Why study here?

Discover some of the reasons that GCU is the top choice for students from more than 130 countries.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/whystudyhere)

Open Days

Visit us to explore our campus, courses, and facilities, and to experience life at GCU firsthand during our university open days. Connect with peers, take a campus and accommodation tour, and gain insights from our staff and students about studying with us.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/opendays)

Scholarships and funding

Discover a range of financial help available to students, including funded scholarships, bursaries, tuition fee reductions and loyalty rewards.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/scholarships)

VISA Information

The Visa Immigration Support and Advice (VISA) Team at GCU are trained to give you advice and assistance on the application process and can check any supporting documents for you before your submission.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/summerschool/visainformation)

text:
Study | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKGlasgow Caledonian University Campus Tour
Find your course
The right university experience is about more than lectures, study halls, and industry placements. We know you have the creativity and curiosity to achieve your full potential and go above and beyond to become part of a bigger movement for change. We are here to support your ideas so that you can go on to contribute, create, lead and influence the way we work and live.
We offer a range of postgraduate and undergraduate courses, with many routes to university study.
Explore our subjects
We offer more than 100 degrees designed to shape your future and help you tackle some of the many global challenges of our time. To make your search easier, we have separated these courses into subject areas.
See all 
Find your path
Online and distance learning 
Develop your skills with an online distance learning Master's course and get all the support you need to succeed with the flexibility that suits you.
Learn more arrow_forward 
Postgraduate research study
Be part of our world-class research. Enjoy supervision and support from the award-winning Graduate School and earn Master's, PhDs, or Professional Doctorates.
Learn more arrow_forward 
College Connect
Whether you have been offered a place at GCU or have yet to apply, the College Connect Team provides a dedicated service at GCU to guide you through the process.
Learn more arrow_forward 
Graduate Apprenticeships
Learn more about graduate apprenticeships at Glasgow Caledonian University, recognised as Scotland's leading provider of graduate apprenticeships. At GCU we specialize in delivering adaptable, work-based education programs.
Learn more arrow_forward 
Glasgow Caledonian University campus tour
Take a virtual look around our campus as our very own Stuart Martin gives you a whistle-stop tour of some need-to-know spots around the University.
Is GCU right for you?
The best way to find out what life is like at GCU is to speak with one of our current students.
Ask a student 
Study with us
markdown:
# Study | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKGlasgow Caledonian University Campus Tour

## Find your course

The right university experience is about more than lectures, study halls, and industry placements. We know you have the creativity and curiosity to achieve your full potential and go above and beyond to become part of a bigger movement for change. We are here to support your ideas so that you can go on to contribute, create, lead and influence the way we work and live.

We offer a range of [postgraduate](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/postgraduate) and [undergraduate courses](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate), with many routes to university study.

### Explore our subjects

We offer more than 100 degrees designed to shape your future and help you tackle some of the many global challenges of our time. To make your search easier, we have separated these courses into subject areas.

[See all](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/subjects)

## Find your path

Online and distance learning

Develop your skills with an online distance learning Master's course and get all the support you need to succeed with the flexibility that suits you.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/distance-learning)

Postgraduate research study

Be part of our world-class research. Enjoy supervision and support from the award-winning Graduate School and earn Master's, PhDs, or Professional Doctorates.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/postgraduateresearchstudy)

College Connect

Whether you have been offered a place at GCU or have yet to apply, the College Connect Team provides a dedicated service at GCU to guide you through the process.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/collegestudents/collegeconnect)

Graduate Apprenticeships

Learn more about graduate apprenticeships at Glasgow Caledonian University, recognised as Scotland's leading provider of graduate apprenticeships. At GCU we specialize in delivering adaptable, work-based education programs.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/business/graduateapprenticeships)

### Glasgow Caledonian University campus tour

Take a virtual look around our campus as our very own Stuart Martin gives you a whistle-stop tour of some need-to-know spots around the University.

* * *

![Undergraduate Students in the Hamish Wood building](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0020/68042/varieties/large.jpg)

## Is GCU right for you?

The best way to find out what life is like at GCU is to speak with one of our current students.

[Ask a student](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/askastudent)

# Current students | Glasgow Caledonian University

Top services

*   [Email:](https://www.outlook.com/caledonian.ac.uk) Access your student email.
*   [GCU Learn:](https://blackboard.gcal.ac.uk/) Lecture notes and course work information.
*   [Student Portal](https://evision.prod.gcu.tribalsits.com/urd/sits.urd/run/siw_sso.saml): Access your registration and financial information.
*   [Service now:](https://gcu.service-now.com/esc) Log IT and other service support requests.
*   [Timetables and Term Dates:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/timetable "timetable") Your individual student timetables.
*   [Discretionary Fund:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/fundingandfinance/fundingyourcourse/discretionaryfund) Struggling for money? Apply to our Discretionary Fund.
*   [Library:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library) Search for journals, books and other library information.
*   [Career Hub:](https://careerhub.gcu.ac.uk/students/login?ReturnUrl=%2fstudents) Your first port of call for all vacancies.
*   [Online Store:](https://store.gcu.ac.uk/) Pay for student essentials.
*   [Inplace:](https://inplace-uk-signon.azurewebsites.net/Account/Login?ReturnUrl=%2Fconnect%2Fauthorize%2Fcallback%3Fclient_id%3Duk-gcu-prod.inplace%26redirect_uri%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fplacements.gcu.ac.uk%252Finplace%252F%26response_mode%3Dform_post%26response_type%3Dcode%2520id_token%2520token%26scope%3Dopenid%2520inplaceprofile%2520offline_access%26state%3DOpenIdConnect.AuthenticationProperties%253DUyKG_SK69M4nflnc0xb8x0ExuPxIaQr4x9X8641uwLmX2SEXALP0AewMq04R8ghFN183WrhqI_ms2RSwj_TpuavJoiQeVLw3tQ76u4pDbJL4A1-N7Wb4nD9T3oYQe6H1VqeBtCNG7uG9JaS0VH7dfpEpu7qmUeuR5e-ng6RCt7XTsD_Ld1SsO0JYEgoovYtUxRxvLGE0-7ApdXKweWyx0PMqXjfbSfiovUPubr3I0AQ%26nonce%3D637480321466189278.MjJmMDc5ZGItZjliZC00ZTA2LWFkN2MtNGU0ZmUwNTBhODk0ZmYyMDIzMGEtMTBmOC00ZTY1LTg5NDctMzQ4MGU3NTUzMGY1) Manage your student placement information.

Contacts

*   [A -Z directory:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/contactus) A list of the support departments and services that we offer to students.
*   [Campus Life Desk:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/lifeoncampus) The central point for access to all student services.
*   [Library:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library) Search for journals, books and other library information.
*   [Visa Immigration Support and Advice:](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/international) Support for both current and prospective international GCU students.
*   [Students' Association:](https://www.gcustudents.co.uk/) GCU Students are automatically part of our Students Association.

*   [Emergency and security](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/lifeoncampus/yourcampus): What to do and who to contact.

Find your course
Glasgow Caledonian - the largest and leading modern university in Scotland – is a vibrant, values-led university with campuses in the heart of Glasgow and London. With a strong commitment to high quality education and research which supports the communities we serve, we have strong partnerships with employers to ensure our students get the careers they dream of and deserve.
We are the only Scottish university with EcoCampus Platinum accreditation and we are 1st in Scotland for sustainability (People and Planet University League 2023/24).
We are a Top 40 UK University in the Guardian University Guide and the UK’s 2nd top performing modern university in the Daily Mail Guide
We offer a wide selection of affordable postgraduate degree courses 
91% of our health research is classified as world-leading or internationally excellent (REF 2021)

We can help you with your English language, make your visa application as straightforward as possible and help you to find accommodation. # International Study | Glasgow Caledonian University

## Find your course

Glasgow Caledonian - the largest and leading modern university in Scotland – is a vibrant, values-led university with campuses in the heart of Glasgow and London. With a strong commitment to high quality education and research which supports the communities we serve, we have strong partnerships with employers to ensure our students get the careers they dream of and deserve.

*   We are the only Scottish university with EcoCampus Platinum accreditation and we are 1st in Scotland for sustainability (People and Planet University League 2023/24).
*   We are a Top 40 UK University in the Guardian University Guide and the UK’s 2nd top performing modern university in the Daily Mail Guide
*   We offer a wide selection of affordable [postgraduate degree courses](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/postgraduatecourses)
*   91% of our health research is classified as world-leading or internationally excellent (REF 2021)

## Scholarships

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0009/10314/varieties/large.jpg)

## Postgraduate webinars

Find out more about studying a postgraduate at GCU with our webinars. Watch recordings or join us live to ask your questions.

[Watch now](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/postgraduate-information-library?SQ_VARIATION_171569=0)

## Download the prospectus

Browse through our latest postgraduate prospectus

[Download](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0021/155172/Postgraduate-Prospectus-2024_21546.pdf)

## Award-winning support

Glasgow Caledonian’s excellent international reputation stems not only from our award-winning [support for international students](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/international) at the University, but also our work with our many partners around the world. We know it’s a big step to move to another country to study, but we’ll make it an easy one. We can help you with your English language, make your visa application as straightforward as possible and help you to find accommodation. We’ll help you settle in and feel at home while you take your learning to the next level.

Student Visa applications (outside UK)

Information on the Student Visa application process from outside the UK.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/international/studentvisaapplicationsoutsideuk)

Application deadlines

Key dates and deadlines for international students applying to study at GCU.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/howtoapply/application-deadlines)

Post Study Work options

Information on the options for international students to work in the UK after their studies.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/international/poststudyworkoptions)

## Why Glasgow?

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0028/159913/varieties/large.jpg)

## Friendliest city

Glasgow ranked the second-best UK city, coming in 61st overall. (Times 2023)

[Find out why](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/whystudyhere/whystudyinglasgow)

## Discover Scotland

Scotland is famous internationally for its breathtaking scenery, tartan, whisky and friendly inhabitants.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/whystudyhere/whystudyinscotland)

### Find your country

Explore entry requirements and connect with our knowledgeable contacts in your home country for personalised guidance on admissions, visas, scholarships, and more. Your academic adventure starts here!

## Contact us

Our dedicated team are happy to help with any queries regarding your application or studies at GCU. Please do not hesitate to [get in touch](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/internationalstudy/contactus).

**Phone:** +44 (0)141 465 5665

**Email:** [enquiries@gcu.ac.uk](mailto:enquiries@gcu.ac.uk "mailto:enquiries@gcu.ac.uk")

## Ask a student

    Unibuddy

## Lisa

### I come from

Edmonton, AB, Canada

## Jack

MSc Big Data Technologies

### I come from

United Kingdom

Getting to know the Library and Archive Centre
Our collection is a mix of on-shelf materials and online resources providing access to more than 500,000 books and ebooks, 350 PCs and a huge range of online resources including databases, journals and more.
You can take a break from your studies in our café or the Relax and Renew area on Level 0.
Speak to our friendly staff at the library desk on Level 0 or chat with us online below. You can also contact your librarian who can help you make the best use of our resources, from developing your topic and choosing sources, to managing your references.
The Library is home to the University Archive Centre, a visually engaging space open to everyone. Our unique archives and special collections include a permanent display of personal objects from Sir Alex Ferguson's life.

markdown:
# Library | Glasgow Caledonian University

Library Search: Discover

Search here for books, ebooks, articles, journals and lots more

## Getting to know the Library and Archive Centre

Our collection is a mix of on-shelf materials and online resources providing access to more than 500,000 books and ebooks, 350 PCs and a huge range of online resources including databases, journals and more.

You can take a break from your studies in our café or the [Relax and Renew area](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/usingthelibrary/wellbeing/relax-and-renew) on Level 0.

Speak to our friendly staff at the [library desk](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/usingthelibrary/thelibrarydesk) on Level 0 or chat with us online below. You can also [contact your librarian](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/appointments/appointmentsdrop-insandenquiries) who can help you make the best use of our resources, from developing your topic and choosing sources, to managing your references.

The Library is home to the University [Archive Centre,](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/archives) a visually engaging space open to everyone. Our unique archives and special collections include a permanent display of personal objects from Sir Alex Ferguson's life.

## Quick links

New to the library

Find out about the services offered by our library

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/usingthelibrary/newtothelibrary)

Opening hours

Find out when the library building is open

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/usingthelibrary/openinghours)

Book a study space

In addition to open and publicly available study spaces, we also have a variety of different bookable study spaces

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/usingthelibrary/bookastudyspace)

Database A-Z

This A-Z lists all databases available to GCU students and staff

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/onlineresources/databasea-z)

Browse journals

Browse a variety of journals by title or subject

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/onlineresources/browsejournals)

Subject guides

These guides highlight subject key resources, help with referencing, and assessing information

[Learn more](https://gcu.libguides.com/)

Referencing

We have a wide range of referencing tools available to help you during your studies

[Learn more](https://gcu.libguides.com/referencing)

RefWorks

RefWorks is an online reference manager tool

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library/onlineresources/refworks)

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0015/64401/varieties/large.jpeg)

## Archiving toolkit

The Social Enterprise Archiving Toolkit (SEAT) helps people value and share their stories and ensure that they are kept safe for future generations

[Access toolkit](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/archives/communitytools/seat)

## Archives and special collections

Learn about the services we offer and the subjects covered in our archives and special collections

[Archives website](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/archives)

# Academic essentials | Glasgow Caledonian University

Welcome to student life at GCU. Find out all you need to know about induction, registration, getting started online, and how to join a society.

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0023/9761/varieties/large.jpg)

## GCU Learn

GCU Learn is the University's online learning platform. It provides information about your course: module handbooks, reading lists, lecture notes.

[Log in](http://blackboard.gcal.ac.uk/)

## Student attendance monitoring

Glasgow Caledonian is introducing a new system to record and monitor student attendance, using the SEAtS system.

[Find out more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/student-attendance-monitoring)

Whether you need access to your student records and documents, support with online learning or to find out more about assessments and exams, the information on this page is here to help.

## Useful links

![Glasgow Caledonian University campus](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0030/9696/varieties/large.jpg)

## Feedback

We need your feedback to keep improving our student services. Visit the link below to contact us and feedback on campus life.

[Get in touch](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/feedback)

text:
Student support | Glasgow Caledonian University
Glasgow Caledonian University takes great pride in providing exceptional student support. We offer a full range of services to help make your time at the University as fulfilling and enjoyable as possible. Below is a selection of the services we provide.
IT service
During your learning experience, you may need help, or have questions about IT. The GCU IT helpdesk is your first point of contact.

# Student support | Glasgow Caledonian University

Glasgow Caledonian University takes great pride in providing exceptional student support. We offer a full range of services to help make your time at the University as fulfilling and enjoyable as possible. Below is a selection of the services we provide.

IT service

During your learning experience, you may need help, or have questions about IT. The GCU IT helpdesk is your first point of contact.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/it)

Induction

Welcome to GCU. Key information on Induction and life at GCU.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/induction)

Student Wellbeing

We provides a free, confidential advice and support service in a safe and non-judgemental environment.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/wellbeing)

Counselling

Our qualified and experienced counsellors/therapists are here to support all University students as part of the Student Wellbeing Service.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/counselling)

Disability service

The Disability Team aims to promote a learning environment which minimizes the impact of disability on the student experience through advice, information and services.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/disabilityservice)

Visa Immigration Support and Advice (VISA) Team

If you require a visa as part of your study application, our International Student Support team have prepared this guide to help you with Tier 4 (General) Student Visa submissions.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/international)

text:
MINT Programme | Glasgow Caledonian University
Mentoring 
Students and new graduates are paired with an experienced GCU alumni mentor who provides industry advice, guidance and support to help their mentee in their next career steps. An incredible 2000 graduates have volunteered so far as mentors, with over 1500 students having completed or underway with the programme, of which 2 in 3 have secured employment or further study.
Internships 
A variety of paid internship positions have been available to GCU graduates in a wide variety of organisations and industries, offering them the opportunity to gain hugely valuable industry experience. Over 120 graduates have secured positions so far, with a quarter of them securing a permanent role as a result.
Networking and Talks 
Through our exciting Captains of Industry Talks series, students and alumni have the opportunity to grow their networks and gain valuable industry insights from industry leaders. Over 2,500 so far have attended these exclusive events, hearing from experts such as President of Millarworld at Netflix, Mark Millar, Group Chief Financial Officer at NatWest Katie Murray and award-winning British Fashion Designer Christopher Raeburn.
Mentoring
Over 1,500 experienced GCU graduates have generously volunteered their time as mentors to the programme.

# MINT Programme | Glasgow Caledonian University

Mentoring

Students and new graduates are paired with an experienced GCU alumni mentor who provides industry advice, guidance and support to help their mentee in their next career steps. An incredible 2000 graduates have volunteered so far as mentors, with over 1500 students having completed or underway with the programme, of which 2 in 3 have secured employment or further study.

Internships

A variety of paid internship positions have been available to GCU graduates in a wide variety of organisations and industries, offering them the opportunity to gain hugely valuable industry experience. Over 120 graduates have secured positions so far, with a quarter of them securing a permanent role as a result.

Networking and Talks

Through our exciting Captains of Industry Talks series, students and alumni have the opportunity to grow their networks and gain valuable industry insights from industry leaders. Over 2,500 so far have attended these exclusive events, hearing from experts such as President of Millarworld at Netflix, Mark Millar, Group Chief Financial Officer at NatWest Katie Murray and award-winning British Fashion Designer Christopher Raeburn.

Mentoring

Over 1,500 experienced GCU graduates have generously volunteered their time as mentors to the programme.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/alumni/mintprogramme/mentoring)

Internships

GCU graduates in a wide variety of organisations and industries at which GCU alumni are employed are offering internships.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/alumni/mintprogramme/internships)

Networking and talks

Graduates and final year students can link up with alumni around the world through our series of networking and talks.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/alumni/mintprogramme/networkingandtalks)

As a direct response to the pandemic, in 2020 the GCU Foundation and Alumni Team launched MINT, an innovative, pioneering new programme to provide help and support to some 5000 final year students and new graduates. Entering a new and very uncertain employment market, the programme enhances their employability and increases their chances of gaining employment at the earliest possible opportunity.

## **Mentoring**

Students and new graduates are paired with an experienced GCU alumni mentor who provides industry advice, guidance and support to help their mentee in their next career steps. An incredible 1800 graduates have volunteered so far as mentors, with over 1300 students having completed or underway with the programme, of which 2 in 3 have secured employment or further study.

## **Internships**

A variety of paid internship positions have been available to GCU graduates in a wide variety of organisations and industries, offering them the opportunity to gain hugely valuable industry experience. Over 120 final year students have secured positions so far, with a quarter of them securing a permanent role as a result.

## **Networking and Talks**

Through our exciting Captains of Industry Talks series, students and alumni have the opportunity to grow their networks and gain valuable industry insights from industry leaders. Over 2,500 so far have attended these exclusive events, hearing from experts such as President of Millarworld at Netflix, Mark Millar, Group Chief Financial Officer at NatWest Katie Murray and award-winning British Fashion Designer Christopher Raeburn.

# Undergraduate courses | Glasgow Caledonian University

## You belong at Glasgow Caledonian

Glasgow Caledonian University is the right place for the career you want. A qualification from GCU prepares you for a successful career. Our graduates have the [joint highest average earnings in Scotland](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/universitynews/glasgow-caledonian-graduates-among-highest-paid-in-scotland) one year after graduating. We are also in the top 15 higher education institutions in the UK for sustained employment, further study or both, one and five years after graduating.

Whether you're coming straight from school, from [college](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/collegestudents) or [returning to study](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/maturestudents) as a mature student – with us, you’ll earn more than a degree. We’re committed to helping you make an impact in the real world, working within our thriving community to gain skills and friendships that stay with you for a lifetime.

Explore our [subjects](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/subjects) or sign-up to come to our [Open Days](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/opendays) and speak to our teaching staff and student mentors. You can also search through more than 100 undergraduate courses below.

## Find your course

### Glasgow: museums and art galleries

In the first of our series about the best things to do in Glasgow, we tell you the three best free museums and art galleries.

* * *

Undergraduate fees and funding

We are committed to providing high-quality education to all of our students at an affordable price. We also offer a scholarship package of more than £2 million per year. Our dedicated team and online resources are on hand to help you manage your finances.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/feesandfinance)

College students

Our College Connect team are here to support your transition from college to GCU.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/collegestudents)

Student support

We'll make sure you have the best university experience possible, offering a range of in-person student support services and top-notch facilities that you can rely on.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/whystudyhere/studentsupport)

Student life

We know student life is about much more than getting an education. We're here to offer the best years of your life, building your confidence, fulfilling your potential and just being yourself.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/whystudyhere/studentlife)

## How to apply

You can apply to GCU online.

[Apply now](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/undergraduate/howtoapply)

## Open Days and campus tours

Find out more about our undergraduate courses and student life at GCU

[Register today](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/opendays)

## Download the prospectus

Browse through our latest undergraduate prospectus

[Download](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0015/205026/UNDERGRADUATE-PROSPECTUS-2025.pdf)

text:
Funding and finance | Glasgow Caledonian University
We're here to help, if you can't find the answer you're looking for on this page, please get in touch.
Student Awards Agency Scotland – SAAS, is now open for 2024-25 full-time and part-time SAAS funded students.
Discretionary Fund 
All Discretionary & Childcare Funds have now closed for the 2023/24 academic year. The funds will re-open for the 2024/25 academic year at the start of Trimester A, funds permitting
The Discretionary Fund is available to help with study and living costs if you are struggling financially. There are certain eligibility criteria that need to be met in order to apply.
Students who are experiencing particular financial hardship should make an appointment to speak to a Funding Advisor.
Applications usually take three to four weeks to fully process. Please note that applications that are not fully completed, or missing relevant documentation, will be moved to the end of the queue and this will result in a significant delay of possibly weeks in processing your application.
Please check the Documents you may need to have ready before applying to ensure you upload all the required documentation with your application
Childcare Fund 
All Discretionary & Childcare Funds have now closed for the 2023/24 academic year. The funds will re-open for the 2024/25 academic year at the start of Trimester A, funds permitting
Non-Nursing & Paramedic students, who have compulsory summer placements, can also apply for help towards registered childcare costs in Trimester C
The Childcare Fund is available for Home students to help towards registered childcare costs during term time. These costs may include a nursery, childminder or after-school care.
Please remember to download the GCU Carer form part A to be completed by your childcare provider.
Carer form
Digital Inclusion Laptop loan scheme 
If you are struggling financially and require a laptop to study your course online, you can apply to the Digital Inclusion laptop loan scheme”.
Scholarships and funding

US federal loans

Additional support

If you live in Scotland and are aged five to 21 years old, you are eligible for a card giving you free bus travel. See the Young Persons' Free Bus Travel Scheme for more information.
Come and see us

Book

markdown:
# Funding and finance | Glasgow Caledonian University

We're here to help, if you can't find the answer you're looking for on this page, please [get in touch](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/fundingandfinance/contactus).

[Student Awards Agency Scotland – SAAS,](https://www.saas.gov.uk/)  is now open for 2024-25 full-time and part-time SAAS funded students.

Discretionary Fund

**All Discretionary & Childcare Funds have now closed for the 2023/24 academic year. The funds will re-open for the 2024/25 academic year at the start of Trimester A, funds permitting**

The [Discretionary Fund](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/fundingandfinance/fundingyourcourse/discretionaryfund) is available to help with study and living costs if you are struggling financially. There are certain eligibility criteria that need to be met in order to apply.

Students who are experiencing particular financial hardship should make an appointment to speak to a Funding Advisor.

Applications usually take three to four weeks to fully process. Please note that applications that are not fully completed, or missing relevant documentation, will be moved to the end of the queue and this will result in a significant delay of possibly weeks in processing your application.

Please check the [Documents you may need to have ready before applying](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/word_doc/0025/126835/Document-Guidance-for-Discretionary-and-Childcare-Applications.docx) to ensure you upload all the required documentation with your application

Childcare Fund

**All Discretionary & Childcare Funds have now closed for the 2023/24 academic year. The funds will re-open for the 2024/25 academic year at the start of Trimester A, funds permitting**

Non-Nursing & Paramedic students, who have compulsory summer placements, can also apply for help towards registered childcare costs in Trimester C

[The Childcare Fund](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/fundingandfinance/othersourcesoffunding/helpwithchildcarecosts) is available for Home students to help towards registered childcare costs during term time. These costs may include a nursery, childminder or after-school care.

Please remember to download the GCU Carer form part A  to be completed by your childcare provider.

*   [Carer form](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/word_doc/0029/126299/Carerform-2024-25.docx)

Digital Inclusion Laptop loan scheme

If you are struggling financially and require a laptop to study your course online, you can apply to the Digital Inclusion laptop loan scheme”.

Scholarships and funding

Discover a range of financial help available to students, including [funded scholarships](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/scholarships), bursaries, tuition fee reductions and loyalty rewards.

US federal loans

GCU has been approved to certify [Federal Student Loans](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/scholarships/usfederalloans) for degree programmes. Complete your application online today.

## Additional support

Did you know that [Money Advice Scotland](https://www.moneyadvicescotland.org.uk/Pages/Category/help-for-people-in-debt%20%20%20) is offering a webchat service to anyone wishing to get debt advice during these difficult times? There is also an online budget and benefits calculator to check whether there is any additional income available to you.

If you live in Scotland and are aged five to 21 years old, you are eligible for a card giving you free bus travel. See the [Young Persons' Free Bus Travel Scheme](https://www.transport.gov.scot/concessionary-travel/young-persons-free-bus-travel-scheme/#overview) for more information.

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0027/9396/varieties/large.jpg)

## Come and see us

Please ensure your enquiry is directed to the relevant team. You can find all relevant contact details for our funding and finance teams.

[Contact us](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/fundingandfinance/contactus)

## Funding appointment

Make an appointment to get practical advice and guidance on funding and scholarship options available to GCU students.

[Book](https://appointments.gcu.ac.uk/)

### We value your [feedback.](https://forms.office.com/e/F5xA3c3Fd2)

# Alumni benefits | Glasgow Caledonian University

As a graduate of Glasgow Caledonian, you are entitled to a range of exclusive discounts on products and services

We are here to support you after graduation, network you with like-minded people and inform you of [exciting job opportunities](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/careers "Graduate job opportunities") which arise when you are part of GCU Alumni.

In addition to receiving our magazines, invitations to events, and access to career support up to two years after you graduate, you also get to take advantage of great campus discounts such as [15% discount on venue hire.](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/alumni/benefits/conferencefacilities)

text:
Research centres | Glasgow Caledonian University
To address the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), we have approved a number of thematic inter-disciplinary research centres, underpinned by an inter-sectoral approach to addressing these challenges locally and internationally. 
In addition to the centres listed below, we have the Moffat Centre located in our Glasgow campus and The Center for Social Impact and Innovation located within our New York campus. We also work collaboratively with other partner universities and organisations across several research units such as NMAHP RU, Scottish Poverty and Inequality Research Unit (SPIRU) and Centre for Social History of Health and Healthcare CSHHH.
ReaCH
We are focused on enhancing the lives of people with long-term health conditions, developing and evaluating public health and lifestyle interventions.
Learn more 
Mary Robinson Centre for Climate Justice
We take a global lead in the delivery of action research that will improve policy, development and critical insights into climate justice.
Learn more 
Built Environment Asset Management Centre

markdown:
# Research centres | Glasgow Caledonian University

To address the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), we have approved a number of thematic inter-disciplinary research centres, underpinned by an inter-sectoral approach to addressing these challenges locally and internationally.

In addition to the centres listed below, we have the [Moffat Centre](https://www.moffatcentre.com/) located in our Glasgow campus and [The Center for Social Impact and Innovation](https://gcnyc.edu/center-social-impact/) located within our New York campus. We also work collaboratively with other partner universities and organisations across several research units such as [NMAHP RU](http://www.nmahp-ru.ac.uk/), [Scottish Poverty and Inequality Research Unit (SPIRU](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/academicschools/gsbs/research/spiru)) and Centre for Social History of Health and Healthcare [CSHHH](https://www.strath.ac.uk/humanities/departmentofhumanities/history/centreforthesocialhistoryofhealthhealthcare/).

ReaCH

We are focused on enhancing the lives of people with long-term health conditions, developing and evaluating public health and lifestyle interventions.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/researchcentres/reach)

Mary Robinson Centre for Climate Justice

We take a global lead in the delivery of action research that will improve policy, development and critical insights into climate justice.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/researchcentres/climatejustice)

Built Environment Asset Management Centre

We explore the social, environmental, and economic interdependencies of sustainable built environments, climate change and natural resources.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/researchcentres/assetmanagement)

WiSE Centre for Economic Justice

The WiSE Centre is a key partner in the work that we do in government to unpick the many, many layers of economic inequality.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/researchcentres/wise)

Yunus Centre for Social Business and Health

We conduct world-leading research to improve lives and communities through a better understanding of community-based and health-focused initiatives.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/researchcentres/yunuscentre)

SMART Technology Centre

The purpose of the STC is to advance fundamental theories, designs, methods, ‌processes and tools to build these systems.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/research/researchcentres/smart-technology-centre)

# Postgraduate courses | Glasgow Caledonian University

## Why study postgraduate?

There are so many reasons to pursue study beyond your degree. You may want to boost your current career, follow a new path, or delve deeper into a topic that you're passionate about alongside like-minded people.

A postgraduate qualification is an investment in your future, a route to increasing your knowledge and earning potential, and a path to a more rewarding career.

We have more than [70 courses](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/postgraduatecourses) and a variety of flexible study options to choose from.

You’ll gain specialist knowledge and skills, which will help you stand out from the crowd as an expert in your field. It is also an investment in your future. Postgraduates earn, on average, 18% more than those with only undergraduate qualifications. (Higher Education Policy Institute 2020).

## Why choose GCU?

*   Our graduate outcomes are excellent. At postgraduate level, 90% of GCU graduates are in employment and/or further study 15 months after graduating, with 86% in a highly skilled occupation (HESA, 2022).
*   We offer generous discounts and postgraduate funding opportunities, including a scholarship package of £2 million every year.
*   Expand your network. At GCU, you’ll gain a global outlook as you study alongside students from over 120 countries and receive authentic input from industry leaders.
*   Make an impact. Be part of the University for the Common Good, taking on your own role in addressing global challenges and building a more just, sustainable society.

### Moffat Scholar Martin Malone

* * *

### Explore our scholarship and discount options

Glasgow Caledonian University offers a wide range of scholarship opportunities and discounts that can help keep the cost of study down.

How to apply

Whether you’re applying from within the UK or from further afield, we aim to make the application process as straightforward as possible and consider every application individually.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/howtoapply)

Enquire today

Ask us anything! Our friendly advisors are on-hand to respond to queries from prospective students and applications to study with us.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/enquire)

Postgraduate research study

Be part of our world-class research. Enjoy supervision and support from the award-winning Graduate School and earn Master's, PhDs, or Professional Doctorates.

metadata.title: Beyond BBV research programme | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UK
metadata.description: Beyond BBV is a dedicated research programme to combat HIV and Hepatitis C for the Common Good led by world-leading blood borne virus experts at GCU.

openGraph.content: Beyond BBV is a dedicated research programme to combat HIV and Hepatitis C for the Common Good led by world-leading blood borne virus experts at GCU.

text:
Beyond BBV research programme | Glasgow Caledonian University
Drawing a line under HIV and Hep C for the Common Good
GCU is a world leader in HIV and Hepatitis C elimination research, strengthened by award-winning collaborative working, our mission for the Common Good and a commitment to the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals.
GCU has launched a dedicated research programme, Beyond BBV (blood borne viruses), to combat HIV and Hepatitis C for the Common Good.
The Beyond BBV research programme – led by world-leading blood borne virus experts at GCU – coincides with the unveiling by the Scottish Government of Scotland’s HIV transmission elimination proposal to end HIV transmission by 2030. The GCU-hosted research programme brings together leaders from research, public health, clinical practice and policy.
Professors Claudia Estcourt and Sharon Hutchinson will be driving the programme alongside GCU Honorary Professors Rak Nandwani, a Non-Executive Director of Public Health Scotland, and Nicola Steedman, the Scottish Government’s Deputy Chief Medical Officer.
GCU’s investment in this dedicated research programme, Beyond BBV, will help yield new insights, working to consolidate and enhance research leadership at a key point in the elimination journey.
Drawing on successful partnership working between academia, public health, clinical and civil society groups – demonstrated by the impact of HIV PrEP and Hepatitis C DAA treatment – Beyond BBV aims to produce world-leading research that can be readily translated into national policy and public health action, to deliver population-level sustained health improvement.
markdown:
# Beyond BBV research programme | Glasgow Caledonian University

## Drawing a line under HIV and Hep C for the Common Good

GCU is a world leader in HIV and Hepatitis C elimination research, strengthened by award-winning collaborative working, our mission for the Common Good and a commitment to the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals.

GCU has launched a dedicated research programme, Beyond BBV (blood borne viruses), to combat HIV and Hepatitis C for the Common Good.

The Beyond BBV research programme – led by world-leading blood borne virus experts at GCU – coincides with the unveiling by the Scottish Government of Scotland’s HIV transmission elimination proposal to end HIV transmission by 2030. The GCU-hosted research programme brings together leaders from research, public health, clinical practice and policy.

Professors Claudia Estcourt and Sharon Hutchinson will be driving the programme alongside GCU Honorary Professors Rak Nandwani, a Non-Executive Director of Public Health Scotland, and Nicola Steedman, the Scottish Government’s Deputy Chief Medical Officer.

GCU’s investment in this dedicated research programme, Beyond BBV, will help yield new insights, working to consolidate and enhance research leadership at a key point in the elimination journey.

Drawing on successful partnership working between academia, public health, clinical and civil society groups – demonstrated by the impact of HIV PrEP and Hepatitis C DAA treatment – Beyond BBV aims to produce world-leading research that can be readily translated into national policy and public health action, to deliver population-level sustained health improvement.

# Life on campus | Glasgow Caledonian University

You will find information on what to expect over the current academic year, here. Any changes to teaching, campus life, travel and current restrictions will be detailed within these webpages.

### Life on Campus

Are you new to GCU? Have a look at our video which will help you find your way around campus.

* * *

## Campus Life Desk

We are delighted to tell you that most of your teaching will take place in-person, on campus. Although you will also have elements of interactive online learning.

This means that you will be able to enjoy a predominately campus-based University experience – the perfect way to meet new friends and make the most of your time at GCU.

As well as the majority of your teaching taking place on campus, you'll also be able to take advantage of the wider University experience, including:

*   Studying in our award-winning [library](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/essentials/library)
*   Grabbing a bite to eat or a drink at one of our four catering outlets
*   Working out at our onsite gym, [The Arc](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/lifeoncampus/healthandfitness/arc)
*   Joining one of our sports clubs or societies via the [Students' Association](https://www.gcustudents.co.uk/)
*   Accessing our in-person student services such as the [Careers Team](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/careers-and-personal-development), [Wellbeing](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support/wellbeing) and [Student Funding](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/finance)

Our Campus Life Desk is located on level 1 of the George Moore Building from Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm. If you have any non-academic queries or questions, one of our team members can help you out. If you wish to speak in private, let our advisors know and they take you to a private room.

You can also get in touch with the team via email at [studentsupport@gcu.ac.uk](mailto:studentsupport@gcu.ac.uk) .

We can't wait to welcome you to campus!

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0027/9387/varieties/large.jpg)

## Events

Keep up to date with the latest events happening on campus.

[Keep up to date](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/getinvolved/events)

## Get involved

There are a number of ways you can get involved with activities on and off campus.

[Find out more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/getinvolved)

![Students on campus with #I AM GCU sign](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0022/9652/varieties/large.jpg)

## Student support

Glasgow Caledonian University takes great pride in providing exceptional student support. Have a look at the services available.

[Support](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support)

metadata.title: Climate Change | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UK
metadata.author: digitalteam@gcu.ac.uk

text:
Climate Change | Glasgow Caledonian University
As the University for the Common Good, GCU is at the frontline of tackling Climate Change through our cutting edge research and education, supporting communities internationally, in Scotland, and in the rest of the UK.
Tackling climate change for the Common Good
GCU is driving change in vital areas for the environment: by helping communities adapt and become more resilient to Climate Change, creating nature-based solutions, implementing a just energy transition, providing clean road transport and delivering climate finance.
We have been proud to be part of the COP26 Universities Network working together to promote a zero carbon, resilient future.
Everyone across society – political leaders, businesses, local councils, educational institutions, grassroots community groups, students, teachers, workers and individuals – has a role to play in overcoming the Climate Emergency we face.
We can accomplish great things, if we work together for the Common Good.
markdown:
# Climate Change | Glasgow Caledonian University

As the University for the Common Good, GCU is at the frontline of tackling Climate Change through our cutting edge research and education, supporting communities internationally, in Scotland, and in the rest of the UK.

## Tackling climate change for the Common Good

GCU is driving change in vital areas for the environment: by helping communities adapt and become more resilient to Climate Change, creating nature-based solutions, implementing a just energy transition, providing clean road transport and delivering climate finance.

We have been proud to be part of the [COP26 Universities Network](https://www.gla.ac.uk/research/cop26/) working together to promote a zero carbon, resilient future.

Everyone across society – political leaders, businesses, local councils, educational institutions, grassroots community groups, students, teachers, workers and individuals – has a role to play in overcoming the Climate Emergency we face.

**We can accomplish great things, if we work together for the Common Good**.

markdown:
# Online and distance learning | Glasgow Caledonian University

Online distance learning is a popular mode of study for many of our students. With a whole range of online distance learning courses developed in collaboration with employers, you’ll find a vocational online master's degree that will help you stand out and move forward.

You have [full access to our academic staff and student support services in a format that is flexible and available when you need it](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/distance-learning/distancelearningexplained). When you choose to study online we can help, providing academic tutoring, assistance with English, career advice, financial support and more.

## Distance learning courses

![](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0027/9756/varieties/large.jpg)

## Fees and funding support

We believe in the power of education to change the world and that everyone can be part of that. Find out what support we can offer you.

Find out more

## Distance learning explained

Discover the benefits of online distance learning.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/distance-learning/distancelearningexplained)

## Next steps

How to apply

Whether you’re applying from within the UK or from further afield, we aim to make the application process as straightforward as possible and consider every application individually.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/howtoapply)

Common Good

Glasgow Caledonian University (GCU) is the University for the Common Good. Our ambitious Vision is that, by 2030, Glasgow Caledonian University will be recognised as a world-leading University for social innovation.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/aboutgcu/commongood)

text:
GOLD Alumni of the Year | Glasgow Caledonian University
The GOLD (Graduates of the Last Decade) Alumni of the Year Awards are an annual honour celebrating the successes and contributions of alumni from Glasgow Caledonian University.
These prestigious awards recognise graduates who have excelled or made outstanding contributions to the Common Good. These achievements can be in their chosen field, but not limited to it. They could include contributions to society, the community, humanitarian issues, the arts, sports, charitable work, or significant improvements to the life and development of the University.
Applications for the 2024 GOLD Alumni of the Year Awards are now open and will close on Sunday 22nd September.
Nominate here for the 2024 GOLD Alumni of the Year
Meet previous Alumni of the Year Award winners
markdown:
# GOLD Alumni of the Year | Glasgow Caledonian University

The GOLD (Graduates of the Last Decade) Alumni of the Year Awards are an annual honour celebrating the successes and contributions of alumni from Glasgow Caledonian University.

These prestigious awards recognise graduates who have excelled or made outstanding contributions to the Common Good. These achievements can be in their chosen field, but not limited to it. They could include contributions to society, the community, humanitarian issues, the arts, sports, charitable work, or significant improvements to the life and development of the University.

**Applications for the 2024 GOLD Alumni of the Year Awards are now open and will close on Sunday 22nd September.**

[Nominate here for the 2024 GOLD Alumni of the Year](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/alumni/alumnioftheyear/gcu-alumni-of-the-year-award-nomination "Nominate here for the 2024 GOLD Alumni of the Year")

## Meet previous Alumni of the Year Award winners

markdown:
# Part-time study | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UKGlasgow Caledonian University Campus Tour

## Career-boosting, life-enhancing learning

At Glasgow Caledonian University, we believe that university is for everyone. But we also know that for many of us, full-time study isn't a practical option.

That's why we offer [flexible, part-time courses](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/part-timestudy/part-timecourses) with a wide range of funding options to help you achieve your goals.

Part-time study at Glasgow Caledonian University lets you boost your career and earning potential while maintaining an income. Our single-site campuses in Glasgow and [London](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/london/home) welcome around 4,000 part-time students each year and host a [range of part-time courses](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/part-timestudy) and learning options from our convenient city-centre locations.

We also provide [work-based learning](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/business) to allow you to study as part of your current job.

### Part-time study options

Many of our part-time courses offer professional accreditation and hands-on experience so it’s no wonder 91% of our graduates are in employment or further study within six months of graduating. (HESA, 2023)

[See all](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/part-timestudy/part-timecourses)

### Join our community of part-time students

At GCU we encourage a range of approaches to study and are proud of the sense of community within our student body.

* * *

![A GCU London student on the rooftop of the London campus, in March 2020](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/__data/assets/image/0006/10023/varieties/large.jpg)

## Part-time at our London campus

Part-time students at GCU London benefit from all the great facilities, support and opportunities that we have to offer at our central city campus.

[Learn more](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/part-timestudy/part-timecourses)

## More resources

Scholarships and funding

Discover a range of financial help available to students, including funded scholarships, bursaries, tuition fee reductions and loyalty rewards.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/study/scholarships)

Student support

Glasgow Caledonian University takes great pride in providing exceptional student support. We offer a full range of services to help make your time at GCU a success.

[Learn more arrow\_forward](https://www.gcu.ac.uk/currentstudents/support)

metadata.title: MSc Financial Technology | Glasgow Caledonian University | Scotland, UK

text:
MSc Financial Technology | Glasgow Caledonian University
The MSc in Financial Technology is designed to prepare you for a career in banking and finance with an emphasis in technologies and data management. In addition to the fundamental skills and knowledge of finance, you will be exposed to leading-edge concepts in artificial intelligence (AI), blockchain (cryptocurrencies), and big data analysis among other emerging topics.
The curriculum draws on GCU’s expertise in diverse areas of finance including regulation, risk analysis, modelling, and securities and investments within the framework of systems architecture, software development, and data management. The content and teaching strategies are designed to help you gain the essential skills and knowledge to prepare you to grow as a professional within the changing landscape of the banking and finance industry.
Advances in technology have brought about radical changes to financial operations, products and services. Key amongst them are activities such as the provision of credit (disintermediation through peer-to-peer lending and crowdfunding), payment systems (blockchain technology and digital currencies), investments (algorithmic trading, online stockbroking services), and personal finance (robo-advisory services for individual investors). These innovations depend on secure and efficient communication systems and the processing of large amounts of data via machine learning algorithms.
The modules in this course will help you gain an understanding of the evolving nature of financial technologies: impact on financial rules and regulation, analysing and managing financial risk, current and emerging trends in different financial sectors as well as challenges and opportunities to the subject and practice of finance. On an equal basis, the course's modules focus on enhancing your skills and knowledge of software development, artificial intelligence, data visualisation and ethics, putting these into practice to solve real-world problems.
This course will enable you to:
Critically apply concepts of machine learning, neural networks, data science algorithms, advanced exploratory statistics to solve financial problems with applications of computational intelligence.
Evaluate the latest software development methodologies and apply the appropriate process to the information system needs of banking and financial institutions.
Critically analyse information collection techniques and analysis methods and manipulate and develop tools and technologies designed for capturing, processing, storing, transferring, analysing, and visualising data for financial applications.
Develop a workable knowledge base and skills in areas of current technological development in finance (such as blockchain, distributed ledger technology, cybersecurity, payment systems and so on) as applied to risk analysis and modelling, regulation, compliance, and investment analysis.
Graduate opportunities
Through its competitive strengths in the technologies sector, government support and entrepreneurial and innovative character, firms in the United Kingdom have gained 10% of the global market share in fintech, a sector which is worth more than £11bn a year to the UK. Approximately 76,000 people work in the sector with this number set to grow to more than 105,000 by 2030. Scotland is now home to over 100 fintech companies and the country has been voted the best European place to start a tech business.
Looking at the broader financial services (FS) workforce in Scotland also provides a steer in relation to aspects such as skills demand within this sector. In 2020, the most in-demand skills within the sector in were commonly digital-based including Java, software engineering, SQL and Python. Digital transformation was also identified within the FS sector as one of the key drivers for skills demand. Digital delivery of services within the sector is expected to result in a need to refocus/upskill sections of the workforce resulting in demand for critical families of skills such as data analytics, software development, business analytics and financial crime.
The government’s Kalifa Review of UK Fintech, commissioned by HM Treasury, published its recommendations on how to best support the growth and development of the UK’s fintech sector. One of the key recommendations from the report has potential direct implications on a new master’s course in this field: "Build a pipeline of fintech talent by supporting fintech scaleups to offer embedded work placements to further education and higher education students and Kickstarters" and "...facilitate stronger connections with universities and the fintech ecosystem" in order to enhance fintech's appeal as a graduate destination and deepen relations between industry and academia.
More broadly, in 2019 the UK Government’s Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) published research with the key recommendation to "Retrain and upskill adults to meet the needs of UK fintech by ensuring access to short courses from high-quality education providers at low cost."
In terms of specific skills, some of those proposed as being included in the MSc Financial Technology’ at GCU show clear evidence of both current and future demand across the UK generally, with data science and machine learning both forecast to see "explosive" growth through to 2023.
In October 2020 the World Economic Forum published research on the future of jobs globally to 2025. FS job roles expected to see an increase in demand over the 2020–2025 period are most commonly digital-based, while those most likely to become increasingly redundant are administrative and clerical roles. Fintech engineers are also in the top 10 emerging roles.

# MSc Financial Technology | Glasgow Caledonian University

The MSc in Financial Technology is designed to prepare you for a career in banking and finance with an emphasis in technologies and data management. In addition to the fundamental skills and knowledge of finance, you will be exposed to leading-edge concepts in artificial intelligence (AI), blockchain (cryptocurrencies), and big data analysis among other emerging topics.

The curriculum draws on GCU’s expertise in diverse areas of finance including regulation, risk analysis, modelling, and securities and investments within the framework of systems architecture, software development, and data management. The content and teaching strategies are designed to help you gain the essential skills and knowledge to prepare you to grow as a professional within the changing landscape of the banking and finance industry.

Advances in technology have brought about radical changes to financial operations, products and services. On an equal basis, the course's modules focus on enhancing your skills and knowledge of software development, artificial intelligence, data visualisation and ethics, putting these into practice to solve real-world problems.

This course will enable you to:

*   Critically apply concepts of machine learning, neural networks, data science algorithms, advanced exploratory statistics to solve financial problems with applications of computational intelligence.
*   Evaluate the latest software development methodologies and apply the appropriate process to the information system needs of banking and financial institutions.
*   Critically analyse information collection techniques and analysis methods and manipulate and develop tools and technologies designed for capturing, processing, storing, transferring, analysing, and visualising data for financial applications.
*   Develop a workable knowledge base and skills in areas of current technological development in finance (such as blockchain, distributed ledger technology, cybersecurity, payment systems and so on) as applied to risk analysis and modelling, regulation, compliance, and investment analysis.

### Graduate opportunities

Through its competitive strengths in the technologies sector, government support and entrepreneurial and innovative character, firms in the United Kingdom have gained 10% of the global market share in fintech, a sector which is worth more than £11bn a year to the UK. Approximately 76,000 people work in the sector with this number set to grow to more than 105,000 by 2030. Scotland is now home to over 100 fintech companies and the country has been voted the best European place to start a tech business.

Looking at the broader financial services (FS) workforce in Scotland also provides a steer in relation to aspects such as skills demand within this sector. In 2020, the most in-demand skills within the sector in were commonly digital-based including Java, software engineering, SQL and Python.
